RESEARCH AND/OR PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE: Concluding with present position, list in chronological order previous employment, experience, and honors. Key personnel include the principal Investigator and any other individuals who participate In the scientific development or execution of the project. Key personnel typically will include all individuals with doctoral or other professional degrees, but In some projects will include individuals at the masters or baccalaureate level provided they contribute in a substantive way to the scientific development of execution of the project. Include present membership on any Federal Govemment public advisory committee. List, In chronological order, the titles, all authors, and compiele references to all publications during the past three years and lo representative earlier publications pertinent lo this application. DO NOT EXCEED TWO PAGES.
Professional Experience:
8/90-present
Associate Professor of Microbiology
State University of New York, Stony Brook, New York
7/84-7/90
Assistant Professor of Microbiology
State University of New York, Stony Brook, New York
Honors and Awards:
1980-1983 Postdoctoral Fellow, The Jane Coffin Childs Memorial Fund for Medical Research
1984-1985 Catacosinos Award for Cancer Research (SUNY at Stony Brook)
Editorial and Grant Review:
Virology, Associate Editor, 1/88 to present; J. Virology, Editorial Board, 7/94 to present; Ad Hoc reviewer for: Molecular and Cellular Biology, Genes and Development
National Science Foundation, Genetics Study Section, 1/90-12/92; Dept. of Energy, External Review Panel, 4/91; National Institutes of Health, Ad Hoc reviewer, Experimental Virology Study Section, 3/91; Ad Hoc reviewer, Virology Study Section, 6/93; Reviewer, p53 and Human Cancer, 3/94
Publications (since 1986):
* Hearing, P. and T. Shenk. The adenovirus type 5 E1A enhancer contains two functionally distinct domains. Cell 45: 229-236 (1986). Ostapchuk, P., J.F.X. Diffley, J.T. Bruder, B. Stillman, A.J. Levine and P. Hearing. Interaction of a nuclear factor with the polyomavirus enhancer region. Proc. Nat. Acad. Sci. USA 83: 8550-8554 (1986).
Cutt, J.R., Shenk, T. and Hearing, P. Analysis of adenovirus early region 4-encoded polypeptides synthesized in productively infected cells. J. Virol. 61: 543-552 (1987). Hearing, P., Samulski, R.J., Wishart, W.L. and Shenk, T. Identification of a repeated sequence element required for efficient encapsidation of the adenovirus type 5 chromosome. J. Virol. 61: 2555-2558 (1987). Leza, M.A. and Hearing, P. Cellular transcription factor binds to adenovirus early region promoters and to a cyclic AMP response element. J. Virol. 62: 3003-3013 (1988).
